figaro.likelihood module

figaro.likelihood.eval_mix(mu, sigma, means, covs)[source]

Computes N(mu_k| mu, (sigma_k^2+sigma^2) for all the components of a mixture (for predictive likelihood, ND).

Parameters:

  • mu (np.ndarray) – temptative mean of the parent mixture component

  • sigma (np.ndarray) – temptative covariance matrix of the parent mixture component

  • means (np.ndarray) – means of the event mixture components

  • covs (np.ndarray) – covariance matrices of the event mixture components

Returns:

probability for each event mixture components

Return type:

np.ndarray

figaro.likelihood.eval_mix_1d(mu, sigma, means, covs)[source]

Computes N(mu_k| mu, (sigma_k^2+sigma^2) for all the components of a mixture (for predictive likelihood, 1D).

Parameters:

  • mu (np.ndarray) – temptative mean of the parent mixture component

  • sigma (np.ndarray) – temptative variance of the parent mixture component

  • means (np.ndarray) – means of the event mixture components

  • vars (np.ndarray) – variances of the event mixture components

Returns:

probability for each event mixture components

Return type:

np.ndarray

figaro.likelihood.evaluate_mixture_MC_draws(mu, sigma, means, covs, w)[source]

Computes N(mu_k| mu, (sigma_k^2+sigma^2) for a set of MC draws for mu and sigma.

Parameters:

  • mu (np.ndarray) – MC draws for the mean vector of the parent mixture component

  • sigma (np.ndarray) – MC draws for the covariance matrix of the parent mixture component

  • means (np.ndarray) – means of the event mixture components

  • covs (np.ndarray) – covariance matrices of the event mixture components

  • w (np.ndarray) – component weights

Returns:

probability for each MC draw

Return type:

np.ndarray

figaro.likelihood.evaluate_mixture_MC_draws_1d(mu, sigma, means, vars, w)[source]

Computes N(mu_k| mu, (sigma_k^2+sigma^2) for a set of MC draws for mu and sigma.

Parameters:

  • mu (np.ndarray) – MC draws for the mean of the parent mixture component

  • sigma (np.ndarray) – MC draws for the variance of the parent mixture component

  • means (np.ndarray) – means of the event mixture components

  • vars (np.ndarray) – variances of the event mixture components

  • w (np.ndarray) – component weights

Returns:

probability for each MC draw

Return type:

np.ndarray

figaro.likelihood.inv_jit(M)[source]
figaro.likelihood.log_norm(x, mu, cov)[source]

Multivariate Normal logpdf

Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) – value

  • mu (np.ndarray) – mean vector

  • cov (np.ndarray) – covariance matrix

Returns:

MultivariateNormal(m,s).logpdf(x)

Return type:

double

figaro.likelihood.log_norm_1d(x, m, s)[source]

1D Normal logpdf

Parameters:

  • x (double) – value

  • m (double) – mean

  • s (double) – var

Returns:

Normal(m,s).logpdf(x)

figaro.likelihood.log_norm_int(x, mu, cov_1, inv_cov_1, cov_2)[source]

Multivariate Normal logpdf (tailored to this problem!) See https://arxiv.org/pdf/1811.04751v1.pdf

Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) – value

  • mu (np.ndarray) – mean vector

  • cov_1 (np.ndarray) – 1st covariance matrix

  • inv_cov_1 (np.ndarray) – inverse of 1st covariance matrix

  • cov_2 (np.ndarray) – 2nd covariance matrix

Returns:

MultivariateNormal(m,s).logpdf(x)

Return type:

double

figaro.likelihood.scalar_product(v, M, n)[source]

Scalar product: v*M*v^T

Parameters:

  • v (np.ndarray) – array

  • M (np.ndarray) – matrix

  • n (int) – len(v)

Returns:

v*M*v^T
